item.title: 世界各国努力吸收特朗普汽车关税带来的冲击
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对汽车进口征收 25% 的关税，这对全球汽车制造商的股价造成了一定的影响，并引发了贸易谈判人员的争夺，以调整他们希望不会激化全球贸易战的应对措施。【原文：President Donald Trump’s plan to impose a 25% tariff on auto imports put a dent in shares of carmakers across the world and set off a scramble among trade negotiators to calibrate a response that they hope won’t intensify global trade wars.】

item.title: 江西铜业警告利润下滑后将持续波动
item.description: 中国最大的金属生产商之一江西铜业股份有限公司（Jiangxi Copper Co.【原文：Jiangxi Copper Co., one of China’s largest producers of the metal, reported full-year earnings that narrowly missed estimates and warned of ongoing volatility in the market.】

item.title: UniCredit 首席执行官将在 Anima 交易完成后审查 Banco BPM 的出价
item.description: UniCredit SpA 首席执行官 Andrea Orcel 表示，他将等待 Banco BPM SpA 对资产管理公司 Anima Holding SpA 的竞购结果，然后再决定如何进行自己对 Banco BPM 的竞购。【原文：UniCredit SpA Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel said he’ll wait for the outcome of Banco BPM SpA’s bid for asset manager Anima Holding SpA before deciding how to proceed with his own offer for Banco BPM.】

item.title: AMD 因与 Nvidia 竞争激烈再次被降级
item.description: 杰富瑞（Jefferies）认为，Advanced Micro Devices Inc. 的技术能力正进一步落后于 Nvidia Corp.【原文：Advanced Micro Devices Inc. is falling further behind Nvidia Corp. in its technological capabilities, a fact that could continue to pressure the stock, according to Jefferies, which downgraded the chipmaker to hold.】

item.title: 贝莱德巴西增长战略瞄准养老基金
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest asset manager, is in talks with Brazilian pension funds to expand further into the 2.9 trillion-real ($510 billion) industry.】

item.title: 英国将在新债券销售策略中出售更多非现金吉尔债券
item.description: 英国正在改变其债券销售计划，将非运行金边债券纳入其中，加大力度缓解市场混乱，并利用较低的收益率。【原文：The UK is shifting its bond sale plans to include off-the-run gilts, stepping up efforts to ease dislocations in the market and to tap lower yields.】

item.title: 前美联储副主席：特朗普面临结束多年通货紧缩的风险
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战有可能将几十年来帮助缓解通胀的强大影响转向相反的方向。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s trade war risks turning powerful influences that helped ease inflation over decades in the opposite direction.】

item.title: 监管不明确，瑞银评级下调，博雅评级下调
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）股价下跌，原因是美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的分析师下调了对该公司股票的建议，称其监管资本要求不明确可能会拖上几个月。【原文：UBS Group AG declined as analysts at Bank of America Corp. lowered their recommendation on the stock, saying a lack of clarity on its regulatory capital requirements is likely to drag on for months.】

item.title: 巴西央行在利率上升的情况下下调经济增长预期
item.description: 巴西央行下调了今年的经济增长预期，表明随着决策者与高于目标的通胀率作斗争，进一步加息将拖累经济活动。【原文：Brazil’s central bank lowered its economic growth forecast for this year, signaling further interest rate hikes will weigh on activity as policymakers fight against above-target inflation.】

item.title: 制裁升级，伊朗满载石油的油轮在马来西亚附近集结
item.description: 近十艘受美国制裁的油轮正装载着伊朗原油在马来西亚附近海域闲置，其中一些已在这个石油转运中心停泊了一个多月；这可能表明，对中国来说十分敏感的石油贸易物流正在放缓。【原文：Close to a dozen US-sanctioned tankers are idling off Malaysia with Iranian crude, with some having been stationed in the oil-transfer hub for more than a month — possible sign of slowing logistics for the sensitive trade to China.】

item.title: Vanguard 就私募市场产品与 Blackstone 和 Carlyle 会面
item.description: Vanguard 集团最近几个月与主要的另类资产管理公司进行了讨论，探讨可能的合作，向个人投资者推销私人资产。【原文：Vanguard Group held discussions with major alternative asset managers in recent months to explore potential tie-ups that would market private assets to individual investors.】

item.title: 投资者关注持续的财政挑战，英国债券下跌
item.description: 由于投资者将注意力转向英国依然脆弱的财政状况以及全球借贷成本上升的风险，英国债券抹去了周三债务计划小于预期后的涨幅。【原文：UK bonds erased the gain notched after Wednesday’s smaller-than-expected debt plan as investors turned their attention to Britain’s still-fragile finances and the risk of a global rise in borrowing costs.】

item.title: Leonteq 股东在股价暴跌后支持增加股利
item.description: Leonteq AG 股东支持瑞士莱法森银行（Raiffeisen Switzerland）的提议，要求这家濒临倒闭的金融科技公司派发更多股息，推动其在股价暴跌后返还更多现金。【原文：Leonteq AG shareholders backed a proposal by Raiffeisen Switzerland for the ailing fintech to pay out a bigger dividend, pushing it to return more cash after a slump in its share price.】

item.title: Janus Henderson 启动 ETF，让全球都能投资美国 CLO
item.description: 美国抵押贷款义务市场规模最大的 ETF 基金（8160 亿美元）背后的公司正在推出一项受欧洲监管的基金，旨在为全球投资者提供具有税收效率的美国证券投资渠道。【原文：The firm behind the largest ETF in the US’s $816 billion market for collateralized loan obligations is launching a European-regulated fund, aimed at giving global investors tax-efficient access to the US securities.】

item.title: SFO 称前瑞银交易员汤姆-海耶斯操纵 Libor 以增加利润
item.description: 检方律师称，前瑞银集团明星交易员汤姆-海耶斯（Tom Hayes）同意操纵和操纵 Libor 以不诚实地提高利润，要求英国最高法院驳回推翻其定罪的企图。【原文：Ex-UBS Group AG star trader, Tom Hayes, agreed to manipulate and rig Libor to dishonestly boost profits, prosecution lawyers said asking the UK’s top court to reject attempts to overturn his conviction.】

item.title: 印度人在手机上花费了一万亿小时，推动了价值 294 亿美元的媒体产业发展
item.description: 根据管理咨询公司易观国际（EY）的数据，2024 年印度人盯着智能手机的总时间将达到 1.1 万亿小时，因为廉价的互联网让世界上人口最多的国家更容易访问从 Instagram 到 Netflix 等平台。【原文：Indians collectively spent 1.1 trillion hours staring at their smartphones in 2024, according to management consultant EY, as cheap internet makes platforms from Instagram to Netflix more accessible to the world’s most populous nation.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡的韦拉辛哈支持以债务换自然换取资金
item.description: 斯里兰卡中央银行行长 P. Nandalal Weerasinghe 说，债换自然可能是斯里兰卡债务重组后筹集资金的第一个机会。【原文：Debt-for-nature swaps could be Sri Lanka’s first opportunity to raise funds after restructuring its debt, the country’s central bank Governor P. Nandalal Weerasinghe said.】

item.title: 前纳斯达克员工被瑞典警方指控内幕交易
item.description: 斯德哥尔摩纳斯达克证券交易所的一名前雇员与其他三名嫌疑人一起被瑞典警方指控犯有严重的内幕交易罪。【原文：A former employee at the Nasdaq Inc. stock exchange in Stockholm has been charged with serious insider trading offenses by Swedish police, alongside three other suspects.】

item.title: 赞比亚经济扩张速度是国际货币基金组织预测的三倍
item.description: 赞比亚第四季度经济产出激增，去年经济增长超出预期，超过了政府和国际货币基金组织的估计。【原文：Zambia’s economy grew more than expected last year, eclipsing estimates by the government and the International Monetary Fund, after a surge in fourth-quarter output.】

item.title: 美国银行为自身竞争融资达 1 万亿美元
item.description: 美国银行增长最快的业务之一，就是向试图抢占其市场份额的公司提供贷款。【原文：One of American banks’ fastest-growing businesses is lending to the very companies trying to grab their market share.】

item.title: 前保尔森合伙人重启对冲基金，支持者包括 Qube
item.description: Orkun Kilic 一年多前关闭了自己的对冲基金，现在他正利用客户提供的资金重新启动基金，其中包括一家最大的跨国投资公司。【原文：Orkun Kilic, who shuttered his hedge fund more than a year ago, is relaunching with money from clients including one of the largest multistrategy investment firms.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚银行免去国家银行专员职务
item.description: 印尼银行已于本周解除了三名被任命为国有银行专员的官员的职务。【原文：Bank Indonesia has honorably dismissed three officials who were appointed as commissioners at state-owned banks this week.】

item.title: 关税担忧席卷而来 对冲基金抢购周期股
item.description: 对冲基金已开始抢购经济敏感型公司的股票，这些公司的股票在过去一个月里因经济衰退的忧虑冲击美国股市而大幅下跌。【原文：Hedge funds have started to snap up the shares of economically sensitive companies that had cratered over the past month as recession worries rocked US stock markets.】

item.title: 新世界寻求 20 亿美元贷款，抵押香港的珍贵资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由于流动性压力持续上升，香港开发商新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co.【原文：Hong Kong developer New World Development Co. has proposed using one of its most valuable assets, Victoria Dockside, as collateral for an additional loan of as much as HK$15.6 billion ($2 billion), according to people familiar with the matter, as liquidity pressure continues to mount.】

item.title: 泰国将赋予市场监管机构更多防止欺诈的权力
item.description: 在一系列企业丑闻打击了投资者信心之后，泰国出台了一项紧急法令，赋予其资本市场监管机构更多的监督和监管权力。【原文：Thailand has introduced an emergency decree to grant its capital markets regulator more power in its oversight and supervision after a series of corporate scandals rattled investor confidence.】
